name: ibis Styles Saint-Malo Centre Historique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you happen to get a good price for this hotel (what we did), it is a perfect option for a stopover in Saint Malo. Expect the usual Ibis Styles fare: very small rooms and bathroom, average service (even my confirmation e-mail - from two hours ago - was for a double bed, the guy in the reception insisted I was not right, whatever..), free wifi and free - simple and cold, not even toaster - breakfast. If your plan is to arrive, leave your things, walk the village and walls, come back for a shower and go for dinner and then to sleep for waking up early to head for Mont Saint-Michel, go for it.
reviews.title: At a good price, great place.

reviews.text: Our third stay at this hotel, but room 104 has less than 1 foot at the bottom of the bed before you contact the wall, and this space is also occupied by the TV on the wall. It's a very small room.
reviews.title: Too many negatives

reviews.text: Biggest problem was the external noise from drunks leaving nearby bars and clubs, which we accept that the hotel cannot control, but the walls of the old town and the walls of the hotel make the noise reverberate alarmingly, and the noise was almost continuous until after 0400 hrs. We asked the desk to complain to the Police Municipal, but we suspect that it is a continuous problem in the summer season.
reviews.title: Lovely, clean, friendly hotel in fabulous location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying in Brittany for a few days, the rain hit hard and we decided to get a hotel nearer the ferry port of Saint Malo, as we were in Roscoff, we asked another chain if they could arrange a room for us in our next destination, they were unhelpful and gave us a catalogue of their hotels in France. Next door was an Ibis and their staff were more than helpful, they rang through to 3 Ibis hotels in Saint Malo, they eventually found a room available for us and booked it. Upon arrival in Saint Malo, we were impressed with the hotel, yes a little bit basic, but the staff were so friendly and showed us where to park. The rooms were clean and stylish and we were lucky enough to have a view over the harbour. We realised how lucky we were to get a room as there was a huge festival going on and the tall boats were all anchored in the harbour, WOW was an understatment!!! After finding a table in a restaurant (which are literally a step away from front of hotel) we enjoyed the party atmostphere of this great city. The hotel included breakfast of the usual bread, cereal and yoghurt, but so very clean. Would def recommend a stay in this hotel, great for a night or two
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: In the inner walls. Arrived and parked bikes outside. Staff friendly with our room on the third floor. No lift but as its a historic building I could do with the exercise. Rooms compact but clean.
reviews.title: Small and Friendly

reviews.text: Ibis styles offers tea and coffee in the lounge area. The breakfast was the usual and enjoyable Ibis fayre.
reviews.title: a welcome surpirse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: City a dream. Would go back
reviews.title: Great location...

reviews.text: this is not a normal Ibis. The location is great, the rooms stylish....
reviews.title: within the walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the heart of the old walled city this hotel was perfect for our needs. We stayed 4 days and found the staff to be very friendly and accomodative of our needs. Rooms were very clean although a bit small (only negative). Breakfast was very good. Would recomend as a very good value for money Hotel. If you're staying in St Malo, stay inside the walled city. It's where the action is.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We returned to this seaside town with our family, after seeing it for ourselves sometime back, and wanting to share it's beauty cool new plus old factors.
reviews.title: Small is the key word but inside the walls of a beautiful resort town that's a walkable treat

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because we couldn't book our first choice and were mostly happy with it (for a reasonably priced hotel that we needed for a large group) although it is indeed small in all ways. IE: small rooms, floorspace, bathrooms, showers, stairwell, micro sized lift etc. Just getting 2 people into the room (the one pictured next to their name above minus the super nice looking curtains) plus your luggage (camera's etc.) was just possible. Forget sharing time in the bathroom and prepare to say "excuse me" allot while 2 are sharing the space. If you get a family room, with a fold out sofa for 2 to share, that will give you a roomier feel. However, you will be on a low floor, with no bay view because there is a castle style wall surrounding one side of the hotel and that and the street will be your view.
reviews.title: Good option right in the old city

reviews.text: All that aside, the lobby was modern and has a friendly, upbeat staff and the small breakfast room with the same vibe. The big bonus: being inside the walls of this high priced area & walking around, especially along the aforementioned wall, that you can image was formerly tread upon by soldiers keeping watch for invaders. Add 2 small and 1 large beaches, and you get a cobble stone lined seaside village where the French play on their holidays & we lucky American's sometimes do too:)
reviews.title: Location - Inside the Walls
Great price for an Intra Muros hotel!
reviews.text: We have stayed twice now, and are booking again as this hotel is a good find in St.Malo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in the annex and yes the lift is small, but this is an old building and so you expect some compromises that allow the hotel to offer such great prices. The view over the city wall more than makes up for the lift and our room was small, but very clean and we found everything we needed to hand. We have also stayed in the main building and again the room was really clean, the bathroom super and the view over the street most entertaining. The people here are lovely, very friendly and helpful, they make the place what it is! We are thrilled to have found a super-clean and comfortable place to stay in St.Malo (some of the other hotels within the city walls we found to be dark, oppressive and expensive for a quick stay). We now plan our journeys in France to take in a stay here.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a last minute booking for two nights. We were on the third floor, which is quite a clime up, as there is no lift but the good thing is that you are then above the town wall. We overlooked the harbour and the yacht marina, towards the casino.Excellent vieuw! The room was a fair size with two good size beds. Everything was clean and working. Nice and quite at night as well. All at half or a third of the price of the more upmarket hotels in the area, where we have stayed in the past. We will be back!
reviews.title: Great location

description: Breakfast and unlimited Wi-Fi are included in all the rates at the All Seasons St Malo Centre Historique. Our hotel is in the heart of the walled city, the historical center of Saint-Malo. It is right by the beaches and just a few minutes from the Palais du Grand Large convention center and the port and ferry terminal. It is also the ideal base for exploring the northern coast of Brittany, the Channel Islands, Mont Saint Michel, Cancale, Dinard and Dinan.
